name: Museum of Modern Art of Bogotá
description: Museum of Modern Art of Bogota. Current headquarters in the center of the city. Instagram: @mambogota Facebook: @fanmambogota Twitter: @_mambogota YouTube: Museum of Modern Art of Bogota See link

image.alt: Instagram: @mambogota </br>Facebook: @fanmambogota</br>Twitter: @_mambogota</br>YouTube: Museo de Arte Moderno de Bogotá

name: Bicentennial Park
description: Located on the north side of the Museum of Modern Art - MAMBO.

name: Planetarium of Bogotá
description: See link

name: Great Britain (British Isles)
description: The Industrial Revolution or First Industrial Revolution is the process of economic, social and technological transformation that began in the second half of the 18th century in the Kingdom of Great Britain, which is a source of great works in the artistic field , also innovating with new artifacts in image capture such as the camera. This image corresponds to the first steam machines that facilitated transport. See link

name: Paris (France)
description: Paris was one of the centers where the first manifestations of the Modern State, enshrined in human rights, took place. Likewise, it was an epicenter of modern art and the anti-academic spirit. Manet was one of the precursor artists of the Impressionism and modern painting. <a href='https://historia-arte.com/obras/olympia-de-manet' target='blank'>See link</ a>

name: Guanajuato (Mexico)
description: Birthplace of the mural artist Diego Rivera famous for capturing works of high political and social content in public buildings. The work of Diego and his wife, the painter Frida Kahlo, influenced each other, and were decisive for the visual identity of Latin American artists. See link

name: Mexico City (Mexico)
description: Mexican popular graphics has influenced all Latin American countries, making visual popular culture an inexhaustible source of inspiration for modern and contemporary artists. See link

name: Málaga (Spain)
description: Place of birth of Pablo Picasso, one of the most important representatives of modern painting. The Image corresponds to the famous Guernica painting by Picasso, painted between the months of May and June 1937, whose title refers to the bombing of Guernica, which occurred on April 26 of that year, during the Spanish civil war. See link

name: Weimar (Germany)
description: The Bauhaus School located in this city had an important influence on modern design and architecture. See link

name: Sainte-Victoire Mountain (France)
description: This image corresponds to many of the paintings that Cezanne developed inspired by the contemplation of these Mountains in a series of paintings between the years 1904-1906. See link

name: Plaza de Bolívar in Bogotá (Colombia)
description: El Bogotazo is known as a series of disturbances that occurred in the capital of Colombia, Bogotá, which were a consequence of the assassination of the leader of the Liberal Party, Jorge Eliécer Gaitán, which occurred on April 9, 1948, a fact that started the history of Colombia in two. See link

name: North of Santander (Colombia)
description: Image corresponds to the work 'Two yellow days' by the artist Beatriz Daza. 1966. Porcelain, glass, ceramic, plaster and metal on wood (birthplace of Beatriz Daza) See link

name: El Sisga (Colombia)
description: This work by Beatriz Gonzales, inspired by the events that occurred in this place, won second prize at the 1965 National Salon of Artists, marking a milestone in modern painting in Colombia. <a rel='nofollow' target = '_blank' href='https://historia-arte.com/obras/los-suicidas-del-sisga'>See link</ a>

name: Cauca (Colombia)
description: Birthplace of Edgar Negret, one of the forerunners of modern sculpture in Colombia. See link

name: Barcelona (Spain)
description: In this city important Latin American intellectuals and artists were found during the 20th century, being also the cradle of movements such as Surealism and Cubism. The Image corresponds to a photograph of the Colombian artist Alejandro Obregón, who was born in this city but He grew up in Barranquilla, becoming an important reference in modern painting. See link

name: Pittsburgh (United States)
description: Andy Warhol is recognized as one of the pioneers of Pop Art in the United States. Warhol used products from the market to reflect on consumerism and originality in art. In this work the artist copied the box of a product from mass consumption and produced a sculpture with 24 reproductions of the packaging, questioning whether any object can be art and pointing out consumerism as the contemporary way of life. See link

name: New Jersey (United States)
description: Birthplace of the artist Barbara Kruger. See link

name: Utah (United States)
description: Place of development of the work Spiral Jetty by North American artist Robert Smithson located in the Utah desert. The material used to make it was about 5,000 tons of black basalt blocks. It was built in 1970, using powerful machines for the movement of the stones See link

name: Brasilia (Brazil)
description: Birthplace of the conceptual artist Cildo Meireles. The image corresponds to the work 'Inserciones En Circuitos Ideológico - 1970 '. See link

name: Barranquilla
description: This city is an epicenter of Caribbean culture and has been the cradle of important musicians, artists and poets. It was the city where the Experimental Art Group 'El Sindicato' was formed in 1979, made up of Ramiro Gómez, Carlos Restrepo, Alberto del Castillo, Efraín Arrieta, Aníbal Tobón and Guillermo Aragón.

name: Cartagena (Colombia)
description: Birthplace of Alvaro Barrios. See link

name: Bilbao (Spain)
description: The Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, designed by the architect Frank Gehry, is an example of 20th century avant-garde architecture. It currently exhibits works by important contemporary artists. See link

name: Belgrade (Serbia)
description: Country of origin of Marina Abramovic, an artist known for being a forerunner of performance. Throughout her life she proposed different artistic actions that tended to involve the public, questioning the limits between art and life. In this work , proposes a very simple action: look the viewer in the eye for as long as he or she decides. This performance invites the public to participate and creates an intimate and deep space in the museum, based on silence and gaze. See link

name: Havana (Cuba)
description: Country of birth of Ana Mendieta, renowned performance, installation and photography artist. See link

name: London (United Kingdom)
description: Birthplace Demian Hirst. See link

name: Matsumoto (Japan)
description: Yayoi Kusama is an artist who builds large environments with textures, stains and colors to provide the viewer with an immersive experience in which the sensation of space and the body change completely. Her installations are spaces where fantasy meets mix with reality.

name: Bristol
description: Banksy (Bristol, United Kingdom - 1974) is the nickname of one of the best known British artists of urban art. From the incursion of Pop Art in graphic and advertising media, artistic practices in urban space have acquired an important role. In this work Banksy makes a critical comment on social inequality and the way in which society hides its problems. See link

name: Rosario (Argentina)
description: Birthplace of the artist Graciela Sacco. See link

name: Springfield (United States)
description: Birthplace of David Hammons, an artist who also became a mediator to talk to the viewer and sell his works of art. See link

name: Bucaramanga (Colombia)
description: Beatriz Gonzalez's birthplace. See link

name: Medellín (Colombia)
description: Capital of Antioquia, second largest city in Colombia. Birthplace of many modern and contemporary artists, including Pedro Nel Ospina, Gonzalo Arango, and Juan Manuel Echavarría, among others. See link

name: Cali (Colombia)
description: Cali is a city that has made important contributions to national art and culture, being the cradle of writers, artists and filmmakers such as Luis Ospina, Andres Caicedo, Karen Lamassone and Fernell Franco. <a rel = 'nofollow' target='_blank' href='https://institutodevision.com/visionarios/fernell-franco/'>See link</ a>

name: Huila (Colombia)
description: Birthplace of Carlos Salas. See link

name: Museum of Modern Art of Medellín (Colombia)
description: Just one year after opening its headquarters, the Museum held the First Latin American Colloquium on Non-Objectual Art and Urban Art in May 1981. Critics and academics debated non-objectualism for four days See link

name: Tomé (Chile)
description: Maria Opazo (Tomé, Chile - 1969) emigrated as a result of the dictatorship to Colombia, where she has received several awards for her artistic work. Her work includes installations, videos, performances and drawings, with which she creates poetic works as acts of resistance that allude to memory and displacement. In this action carried out on a beach in Magdalena Medio, his performative interest in the video is evidenced. See link

name: Dominican Embassy (Colombia)
description: The Taking of the embassy of the Dominican Republic, also called 'Operation Freedom and Democracy', was an armed action by the M-19 guerrilla group carried out in 1980, in which the embassy and they kidnapped 16 diplomats for two months. See link

name: Ciénaga (Colombia)
description: The Bananeras Massacre was the massacre of the United Fruit Company workers that took place between December 5 and 6, 1928 in the municipality of Ciénaga, Magdalena. See link

name: New York (United States)
description: The LGBT movement formally began in 1969 in New York City, with the march that followed the so-called Stonewall riots, although various organizations and activists had taken the first steps of the LGBT movement since late 19th century This photograph corresponds to the Stonewall Revolt which consisted of a series of spontaneous and violent demonstrations in protest against a police raid that took place in the pub known as Stonewall Inn, located in the New York neighborhood of Greenwich Village. n See link

name: Berlin (Germany)
description: The fall of the Berlin Wall was a pivotal event in world history that marked the fall of the Iron Curtain. The fall of the inter-German border took place soon after.

image.alt: Unknown author. Photograph of the Berlin Wall. 1989. Source: Wikimedia Commons under GNU licence.

name: Hanoi (Vietnam)
description: Vietnam War. The images obtained in the middle of the conflict were of great relevance, such as this photograph by Nick Ut, in which a girl is seen running naked down a road after an attack. The city in the one that lodged most of the army was Hanoi. Large demonstrations were held in the world against this war, in which the United States had to withdraw. See link
